Posts.Content: On Jun 22, 2014 4:28 PM alicekay wrote: On Jun 22, 2014 3:18 PM Dlynn1210 wrote: On Jun 22, 2014 2:24 PM alicekay wrote: As a Christian I'm more than a little surprised at the harsh words and judgment toward Breast Ca4. This woman has terminal cancer and as Christians we should be showing her love, kindness and respect regardless of what she believes. I will pray for love and understanding. 1 John 4:7  Beloved, let us love one another, for love is from God, and whoever loves has been born of God and knows God.  Alicekay - As you said yourself, we are not here to judge but as Christians we are not asked but "instructed" to share God's words with others. I read back through the posts and don't see any harsh words or judgements from anyone except Breatr Ca4. I have been involved in the mission field for many years and what I shared and what others shared were encouragements to a woman who may well be facing the end of her life in a short time - a woman who doesn't know God. As Christians we are not judging but praying for her that she does come to know our Heavenly Father while she still can. She obviously didn't want to hear anything about God or read scriptures. We know that we will not touch everyone but we are doing as God and his son instructed us to do. Perhaps, the fact that she left was a good indication that our words were having an effect on her because that means there is still hope. We may be the first, second, or third stepping stone leading to her salvation. We never know when something said will click some time in the future if not now. Everyone here showed her kindness, love, and respect even though it was not returned. To sit back and say nothing would be have been disobedient to God - and especially important to speak up in light of her poor prognosis. .................................................................................................................................................... Mark 14-15. 14 - Afterward He appeared to the eleven themselves as they were reclining at the table; and He reproached them for their unbelief and hardness of heart, because they had not believed those who had seen Him after He had risen. 15 - and He said to them, "Go into all the world and preach the gospel to all creation. .................................................................................................................................................... We did as Jesus instructs us to several times in the Bible - we took the time to share the Gospel with her - possibly the only time she will have the opportunity to hear it. ....................................According to her, she didn't want to hear any God crap and that is why she left but somewhere down the line she may rethink her position about God................. I have found that at times Christians can be the hardest on and most judgmental of other Christians but then no human being is perfect. Have a blessed day alicekay. ............... Diana There is a difference between instructing God's words with others and being judgmental and cruel . “I hope you find my words helpful as you prepare for you own annihilation.” “ It's rude to turn this into your problem and start policing the comments.” “It's merely a satanic attack. “ “There is no need to respond back because it will just prompt other Christians to share the Gospel with you “  “If you are looking for a argumentative discussion on theology, I suggest you find a site where life is not so fragile and where your hurtful words will not harm those in the weakest moments in their lives. “ This woman has cancer and has the right to feel however she feels. As Christians we need to love everyone regardless of their beliefs and the God I believe in is a kind and loving God. It is people like you and others on this thread that give true Christians a bad name. I will pray that the people here can see the error of their ways. Praise God. alicekay, Spoken as a true Christian!  The "satanic attack" comment made by others was upsetting to me also.  I am a Christian and being a Christian has been of great comfort to me and my family. Getting religious advice and comfort from someone I know is always welcome, especially when I ask for it.  I don't need nor want any anonymous witnessings or preaching.   To bring up religion and then refer to a non- believer's comment as a satanic attack is wrong.  These internet cancer Christians need to spend more time in church and less time on CC.  Charles
Posts.Title: Best friend has stage 4 cancer - getting worse. I'm lost.

I was not the one who wrote satanic attack but it sounds as if I interpreted it differently than you and alice did. When we are not the author, we often don't understand the meaning behind certain words. We can take words differently than what someone meant. I did not understand satanic attack to mean breast's comment but rather that very often when God's words are offered, Satan tries to counter those words and undermine God's work! That happens frequently - I have very close friends who are missionaries and dedicating their life to The Lord outside the U.S. The more good they see from the fruits of their labor, the more Satan worked against them. This went on for a year but as we all know, we've read the book and know who wins in the end. Diana Dlynn, The satanic attack quote was indeed not made by you. I was only agreeing with Alice's opinion of the satanic quote responce.  What was said was "Your comment is negative and not answering Emily's question.  It's merely a satanic attack." The comment means what it says.  At best it means satan is working through "breast." My opinion pertains not only to this statement but others that have been made in the past.  Members have left CC because of how their non religious beliefs were delt with.  Something all Christians should keep in mind when responding to believers and non-believer is this. Colossians 4   Devote yourselves to prayer, being watchful and thankful.  And pray for us, too, that God may open a door for our message, so that we may proclaim the mystery of Christ, for which I am in chains.  Pray that I may proclaim it clearly, as I should.  Be wise in the way you act toward outsiders; make the most of every opportunity.  Let your conversation be always full of grace, seasoned with salt, so that you may know how to answer everyone. I too am now bowing out of this discussion.  Charles
